questions.neutral: Is the city acting weird lately?

hobby.message: Still folding origami to stay grounded?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I fly FPV drones. It's a way to escape the noise of the city.
neutral_answer: City's stranger, yeah. Feels off.
Even flying my drones, the usual zones are crowded now.
People poking around, hunting signals—messy.
Harder to find quiet airspace lately.
Yeah, city’s tense. Everyone’s out looking for hidden records or chasing rumors.
Tried to get some drone flying in last week.
More people snooping around industrial zones than usual.
Air got noisy, too much interference.
Makes even hobbies feel watched.
Feels off, for sure. Must be all those Halden data hunts.
I fly FPV drones, usually to clear my head.
Last time, my favorite spot was packed—random techies everywhere.
Some tried scanning my rig for secret data.
Kind of ruins the quiet, you know?
Hard to relax when everyone’s on edge.
The city’s gotten weird—lots of people scanning for hidden BCI secrets these days.
FPV drone cruising used to be an escape.
Now my go-to field’s crawling with activists and ex-IT types.
One crew flagged me, thought I was masking data.
I had to let them check my flight logs.
Used to be no one noticed us pilots.
Feels like even hobbies are under suspicion lately.
Definitely. Since the BCI leaks, everything’s upside down.
I usually go off-grid to fly freestyle drones near the Ivankova yards.
That spot was deserted before, now there’s groups combing it for hidden antennas.
My gear got jammed by someone thinking I was leaking Council files.
Even had folks demanding to scan my drone telemetry.
Nobody cared about ‘spectrum etiquette’ till those Halden broadcasts dropped.
Funny—my brother used to fly with me before he vanished in a BCI audit.
Feels like the hobby’s changed—now every flight’s a risk, not just play.
hobby_answer: Yeah. Still fly. Not many spots left open these days.
Everyone's jumping on the bandwagon after those Halden broadcasts.
Airspace is crowded—never seen so many scanning rigs out at once.
Not as relaxing when people are out there hunting for signals.
I keep it simple. No reason to stand out.
Yeah, I dodge towers. Been harder since the blackout and leaked caches.
That Halden thing—now everyone thinks flying means you’re smuggling.
Spectrum’s noisy. Saw people sweeping for data packets last flight.
Had my telemetry checked twice by strangers, not officials.
Keeps the nerves sharp, I guess.
Hard to get real peace out there.
Yeah, still flying drones. Gets tricky with all the new signal hunters.
After the Halden leaks, more people in the abandoned zones.
Used to be empty, now everyone's chasing transmitters from pirate broadcasts.
Had a crew interrupt my flight, thought my drone was carrying data caches.
Saw a few old-timers dust off analog gear looking for hidden antennas.
I just want some clear sky, but feels like everyone’s a watchdog now.
Still worth it for that moment of control.
Yeah, dodging towers. It’s supposed to clear my head, but lately it’s chaos.
Since the Halden broadcasts, even the abandoned factories are full of tech hunters.
Last week, I hit spectrum jamming. Thought I'd lose the quad to someone’s brute-force scan.
A ground crew wanted to see my flight log, not even official, just paranoid residents.
Some people were mapping signals, looking for hidden broadcasts and old Council data.
Wasn’t always this tense, but everyone’s either nervous or hunting secrets now.
Makes it harder to focus, but the air’s different out there.
I miss the quiet, honestly.
Yeah, still flying, even if it’s more complicated now.
Started when my brother disappeared—something about pattern recognition helps settle my mind.
Lately, the old flight spots are swarming with people tracing those ‘Halden’ clues.
I nearly got flagged by a rogue scanning crew—they thought my transmitter was a cache relay.
Everyone’s weaponizing telemetry and analog gear like it’s the old BCI trial days.
Saw someone actually try to brute-force my drone’s handshake mid-flight.
Never used to worry about who saw my channel list—now, every flight is a risk.
Feels like the whole city is tuned into secrets and signals, not the sky.
But I still go, even if it means hiding more than flying.
